citeinfo.title: Cultivation and Farming of Marine Plants

descript.abstract: Cultivation of seaweed is gaining interest on a worldwide scale. It is being used as food, fertiliser and resource for chemical constituents. Approximately 500,000 tons are being traded annually with a value of about 1 billion US dollars. In cooperation with ETI, Dr A.T. Critchley of the University of Witwatersrand in South Africa and Prof. M. Ohno of the Kochi University in Japan constructed this interactive multimedia information system on the 25-odd species of importance to rearing. ETI’s interactive Linnaeus II software warrants ease of use in consulting this unique electronic database. An interactive glossary of terms and an up-to-date literature reference section are included.
descript.purpose: This CD-ROM contains a unique compilation of detailed species information, an identification guide, and an overview of rearing methods and problem solving.
descript.supplinf: This information was obtained from the ETI web site - http://www.eti.uva.nl/Products/CD-catalogue.html. (previous geoform was 'CD-ROM database')

cntinfo.cntinst: info@eti.uva.nl - general information about ETI. Phone and fax numbers are for general information. Email adress webmaster@eti.uva.nl may know the most about the online World Biodiversity database.

dataqual.complete: 25 important species of seaweed are included

overview.eaover: Entity - marine plants including seaweed; Attributes - detailed species information, an identification guide, and an overview of rearing methods and problem solving.

distinfo.distliab: ETI is committed to updating its CD-ROM publications in the above mentioned series, including adapting them to hardware configurations and computer operating systems to come (meaning that they will be replaced by new versions when big changes occur). All users of ETI CD-ROM products and the Linnaeus II software can ask for support at our by a helpdesk [support@eti.uva.nl]. We will do our very best to help you with any questions that may arise.

stdorder.ordering: The CD-ROM can be ordered at your local bookshop, and the following distributor(s): Springer Customer Service, Haberstrasse 7, 69126 Heidelberg, Germany; fax: +49 (0) 6221/345 229; e-mail: orders@springer.de; UNESCO Publishing, 7, place de Fontenoy, 75352 Paris 07 SP, France. ETI-partners may order directly at ETI as they receive a discount on the retail prices of all CD's. The Linnaeus II software for Biodiversity Documentation can be purchased only at ETI.

distinfo.techpreq: Windows: Windows 3.1x/ 95/98, 486 CPU, 8MB RAM, Thousands of colors, Sound blaster or compatible sound card, 4x speed CD-ROM or higher. Macintosh: System 7.x/8.x, 68040/PowerPC CPU, 8MB RAM, Thousands of colors, 4x speed CD-ROM or higher.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Biological Data Profile of the Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
